Body:
I followed the tutorial to connect my Raspberry Pi with an application on Bluemix using the IoT Foundation:

https://developer.ibm.com/bluemix/2015/04/02/tutorial-using-a-raspberry-pi-python-iot-twilio-bluemix/

The problem is that nothing is happening the "Turn light on/off" buttons of the web application.

If I check the logs of the python app using "./cf logs myappname -recent" I get the following output

2016-03-13T15:00:01.37+0530 [RTR/1]      OUT souvikiot.mybluemix.net - [13/03/20	16:09:30:01 +0000] "GET / HTTP/1.1" 200 0 751 "http://souvikiot.mybluemix.net/"	"Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.3; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML
yes...I do...Everything goes good according to the tutorial.
@SouvikSarkar it looks like things are ok in the bluemix app.  Can you please update your question with output from the pi as well?
Take a look here its simple: http://hackaholic.info/raspberry-pi-controlling-led-over-network/
Thanks Hackaholic.But I need to deploy it in bluemix.
I assume that you adapted the device id to your RaspPi?
@Souvik_Sarkar Are you still having this problem or did you resolve it?
Hi, Jeff & ValerieLamkin , I resolved the issue. Thanks.It's a nice tutorial from Jeff.
@SouvikSarkar  can you please update this post in the answer section with how you resolved the problem so other users will know the solution if they encounter a similar problem. Thanks!
I have some issue with the firewall that I installed in my Raspberry.
